description.narrative:
1.1 5 pre-fabricated toilets will be relocated to a school 1.2 Two shower units will be installed 1.3 Cleaning committees established and trained to maintain toilet & shower blocks
2.1 Access points and additional storage added to pre-existing water system to enable 10 beneficiaries to access water at any one time instead of 1 person. 2.2 The existing water system will be extended to the school

A massive earthquake, reaching a magnitude of 7.0, struck Haiti on January 12th 2010 approximately 15 km southwest of the capital Port-au-Prince. The earthquake was followed by a series of aftershocks as well as by another earthquake on 20th January 2010, measuring 6.1 on the Richter scale. An estimated 250,000 people were killed in the earthquake. Widespread damage to infrastructure, public and private buildings was caused; electricity and water supply, health care services and communication systems were heavily affected. 97,294 houses destroyed and 188,383 damaged in the Port-au-Prince area and in much of southern Haiti
The needs have been jointly identified by ADRA and those stakeholders, the project will increase the security of the school, will give the school children and teachers the access to some facilities, will help the families to improve the quality of their environment, and facilitate a better water distribution.
The objectives are to improve the sanitation of the village, and to increase the populations access to water
